comments.commentBody: Oh, go ahead.  Vote for him several times.  After he and his ilk disenfranchise or do worse, to the old, the infirm, the poor and the minorities, they'll come for you.  And nobody will be there to help you. You are not among the chosen.

Where do you get your information Jack?
I am not depended on any government and I will gladly support Obama. Your tax dodging job-kiling mormon does not look all that convincing to me.
I have just one question: what?
poor, poor Mitt--It's so unfair that the NY Times keeps reporting every stupid thing that he says!
And, Edward, I imagine you're pro-life, too, aren't you?  Time to turn off Fox and get out of the echo chamber.

Right, the poor are *too rich* and the rich are *too poor*.

I'd say more, but I have urgent appointments back on planet Earth.

Did not Mitt get a $70,000 tax credit on his pet horse? If this is not welfare (Republican), what is? Is his 13% tax rate (well below what most taxpayers pay) also sound like Mitt is carrying "his weight"?

Please, give us a break. If anything it shows how detached he is from the reality of the nation.
But then Mitt couldn't vote

Ah, another Republican duped into voting against herself.

How typical.
You have shown YOUR heart - the rest of us are "losers."  You must have an incredible shame driven need to "win."  I feel sorry for you.
Oh, so you virtuous hardworking Romney supporters are going to end up on the dole, too? But I thought poor people were all lazy and wanted handouts, and we all know that's not true of YOU!

Jennifer, Census Bureau statistics show that the poorest 15% of Americans have more material wealth (living space per person, electronics, indoor plumbing, food choice, etc.) than:

A. the average American 15 years ago
B. the average Western European now

This has been true every decade. Our system has encouraged people to work hard to provide goods and services for each other. In a free market, people get rich by out-serving others. When government steps in, people get rich by having a Man in Washington who will regulate their product or service into the market or hurt their competition.

We need to focus on getting people away from government dependency, because government dependency increases the centralized power of government, which is dangerous. Government elites like dependency, because they can control people and consolidate power. Family, friends, community, and States can and will take care of people who can't take care of themselves. They are up close and personal with problems, and can tailor responses according to peoples' true needs, and can demand more from those who really can and should be working.

In better times, the 'electorate' represented tax payers, not moochers looking for generational handouts.

Romney simply made an accurate observation, albeit its not often that happens.

Darn right we will remember that Obama supports that evil, Marxist mentality.

Its highly likely that most subscribers to the NYT are closet Marxists so it should be no surprise that its the same 'blame Romney' horsecrap that written here without looking at the incumbant whose record is down right laughable.

to quote Alexis de Tocqueville

“A democracy cannot exist as a permanent form of government. It can only exist until the voters discover that they can vote themselves largesse from the public treasury. From that moment on, the majority always votes for the candidates promising the most benefits from the public treasury with the result that a democracy always collapses over loose fiscal policy, always followed by a dictatorship. The average age of the world's greatest civilizations has been 200 years.”

This indeed is the voting history of Democratic voters. we're on track for this timeline to end soon.
He didn't say that, the article assumed it.
Do you want to see Obama's college transcripts?
The truth is the truth. And I can read between the lines--you are a liberal and never had any intention of voting for Romney.

I'm sure we'd all agree that bankers, lawyers, and especially consultants for private equity firms are just the most generous, charitable, unselfish guys you could hope to meet. They are giving massive donations to their PACs and preventing minorities from registering in swing states because they just want to give back to the rest of us.

The selfish working class Americans who make less than the median income should all kiss the shined $1000 shoes of Mitt Romney and his ilk for letting even a little of their largesse trickle down to the unworthy firefighters, policemen, construction workers and teachers in the lower 50%.

We have the debt we have because eight years of mismanagement by the Bush Administration created a $3 trillion war that killed thousands of Americans - and even more Iraqis. We have the debt we have because Republican laissez faire approach to regulation allowed rampant speculation on Wall Street and in the real estate industry, which led directly to the largest financial crisis since the Depression. Illegal aliens and people on welfare? You're just looking for scapegoats!

LOL, and that man pays in a year what you will pay in your lifetime.

I just wish MR would take off the gloves and say, ok you want to make my tax returns an issue, I will release them when Zero releases his school and passport records.
Yes sir, fools "see" lets of imaginary things...

Noone in America is entitled or should be entitled or should think they should be entitled to any govt money or programs if they are below social security age and not disabled.  The good book says pretty clearly that if you don't work, you should not eat.   We should cancel all EBT benefits unless the folks are older and/or infirmed.
Why do the blue states, where most of the "contributors" live, vote for Democrats, while the red states, where there are more people on the dole, vote Republican? You are deceiving yourself.

The problem we have that the system is now benefitting the elite - adding to the yawning chasm between the wealthy & the poor. In this environment, the economy and democratic institutions are weakened. Socialist? You've been watching too much Fox News.

David, you speak of those "who contribute no value whatsoever" as those Romney despises?  Who are you and Romney?  God?  You know who has value, and it's all about money, huh?  May the God who IS God forgive you.

Steve S,

I wouldn't have a problem with cutting defense spending and being completely reliant on our nuclear capabilities as a deterrent. Defense spending isn't the major problem, however, it is spending on medicaid (defense spending is a fraction of medicare spending). Unfortunately, this spending is viewed a "right". Rationing of care will never be acceptable (you can't ration my rights!) and spending will spiral out of control until there is a real budget crisis. Democrats are moving the programs in the other direction, to include more and more people.

The idea shouldn't be to cut taxes for the rich. It should be to cut taxes across the board and purge loopholes. An untouchable loophole like the mortgage interest deduction is illustrative. It benefits the rich more than the poor (as the rich have borrowed more money for bigger houses). It causes housing prices to go up (as people are able to spend more on housing) and is really therefore only a boon to the real estate agents (a deduction for mortgage interest doesn't do much for the taxpayers if it drives the price of housing up). However, if something like this were discussed openly, Democrats would submarine it by saying that it was a cut on benefits to millions of working class Americans (ignoring a corresponding reduction in their tax rates).
